intro: Crassula decumbens var. brachyphylla, commonly known as the dwarf crassula or compact crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features dense, low-growing rosettes of fleshy, green to bluish-gray leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. This variety is prized for its compact form and ease of care, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
